spec.name: Lutetia Ciné-Theatre
spec.description: The Lutetia Ciné-Theatre is a historical entertainment venue in Casablanca, built in the mid-20th century. As a 'Ciné-Theatre,' it was designed to accommodate both **cinema screenings and live theatrical performances**, reflecting the diverse cultural needs of the city's population during the Protectorate and post-independence eras. Its architecture likely incorporates Art Deco or Modernist features typical of these grand, multi-purpose venues.
